hypothesis_content.title: Whale Accumulation Detected via Stablecoin Supply Contraction
hypothesis_content.statement: When aggregate stablecoin supply (USDT+USDC) contracts by >1.5% weekly while BTC price holds above its 20-day SMA, whales are accumulating ahead of a regime shift from NEUTRAL to BULL within 7-10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Whales convert stables to BTC during neutral regimes, reducing circulating stable supply. This 'dry powder' deployment typically precedes institutional inflows. The 20-day SMA filter avoids catching distribution during bear trends.
entry_conditions: BTC price > 20-day SMA by 2-5% (avoiding extreme deviations)
Aggregate exchange stablecoin balances decrease while BTC balances increase (net outflow)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC breaks above 3-month high on >20% volume spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Stablecoin supply resumes expansion (>+0.5% weekly) without price breakout

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Stablecoin supply contraction continues (>2 weeks) without price appreciation, indicating capital exit from crypto entirely rather than rotation into BTC.
